The Centers for Disease Control and Prev: CDC) analyzed American Red Cross blood donations from December 13, 2019, to January 17, 2020, and found evidence of the virus in 1.1% of blood donations, suggesting the presence of coronavirus infections in the U.S. in December 2019.
The study had limitations: including the possibility of false-positive antibody tests, which could affect the accuracy of the results.
It is important to note that the presenc: S. in December 2019 does not necessarily mean it was spreading widely at the time, and further research is needed to understand the extent of the virus's presence and transmission during that period.
